definition: It is hard to change one's essential nature (idiom). You can't change who you are./Can the leopard change his spots? (Jeremiah 13:23)
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
it is easier to change mountains and rivers than to alter one's character (idiom)/you can't change who you are/Can the leopard change his spots?
pinyin: jiang1 shan1 yi4 gai3 , ben3 xing4 nan2 yi2

sentences.english: Change of habit cannot alter Nature.
Nature is hard to be overcome, but she must be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 尽管本性难移，但是本性一定要移。

sentences.english: I don't think so. Can the leopard change its spots?
sentences.chinese: 我不这样认为，有道是江山易改，本性难移啊。

sentences.english: Change of scene is not change of nature.
sentences.chinese: 这正是江山易改，本性难移。

sentences.english: Mark:Now you know he won't change.
sentences.chinese: 现在你知道他本性难移了吧。

sentences.english: This is what we say" leopard change his spots".
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们俗话说的“江山易改本性难移”。

sentences.english: Now you know he won't change.
sentences.chinese: 现在你知道他本性难移了吧。

definition: lit. a dog can't stop himself from eating shit (idiom)/fig. bad habits are hard to change
pinyin: gou3 gai3 bu4 liao3 chi1 shi3

definition: rivers and mountains are easy to change, man's character much harder
pinyin: jiang1 shan1 yi4 gai3 bing3 xing4 nan2 yi2

definition: a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

definition: women love bad guys
pinyin: nan2 ren2 bu4 huai4 , nu:3 ren2 bu4 ai4

definition: one may know a person for a long time without understanding his true nature (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhi1 mian4 bu4 zhi1 xin1

definition: fickle/mercurial/changeable/capricious/to be apt to change
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
like father, like son (idiom)
pinyin: you3 qi2 fu4 bi4 you3 qi2 zi3

definition: hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
natural instincts/nature/inherent quality
duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
lit. not to shed a tear until one sees the coffin (idiom)/fig. refuse to be convinced until one is faced with grim reality
pinyin: bu4 jian4 guan1 cai5 bu4 luo4 lei4

definition: the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
